ticket.title: ActiveResource Failed With Rails 2.2.1
ticket.original-body:
When Rails try to generate <% form_for(@product) do |f| %> for an ActiveResource::Base Product, it's failed like that : product_url failed to generate from {:action=>"show" ... and with move to 2.1.2 and restart mongrel, it's work well. config/routes.rb ActionController::Routing::Routes.draw do |map| map.resources :products ... end Full error message : Processing ProductsController#new (for 127.0.0.1 at 2008-11-18 14:22:16) [GET] *[4;36;1mSQL (0.2ms)*[0m *[0;1mSET NAMES 'latin1'*[0m *[4;35;1mSQL (0.1ms)*[0m *[0mSET SQL_AUTO_IS_NULL=0*[0m *[4;36;1mSQL (0.1ms)*[0m *[0;1mSET NAMES 'latin1'*[0m *[4;35;1mSQL (0.1ms)*[0m *[0mSET SQL_AUTO_IS_NULL=0*[0m Rendering template within layouts/products Rendering products/new ActionView::TemplateError (product_url failed to generate from {:action=>"show", :id=>#, :controller=>"products"}, expected: {:action=>"show", :controller=>"products"}, diff: {:id=>#}) on line #3 of app/views/products/new.html.erb: 1:

ticket.original-body-html:
When Rails try to generate <% form_for(@product) do |f| %> for an ActiveResource::Base Product, it's failed like that : product_url failed to generate from {:action=>"show" ... and with move to 2.1.2 and restart mongrel, it's work well.

config/routes.rb

ActionController::Routing::Routes.draw do |map| map.resources :products ... end

Full error message :

Processing ProductsController#new (for 127.0.0.1 at 2008-11-18 14:22:16) [GET] [4;36;1mSQL (0.2ms)[0m [0;1mSET NAMES 'latin1'[0m [4;35;1mSQL (0.1ms)[0m [0mSET SQL_AUTO_IS_NULL=0[0m [4;36;1mSQL (0.1ms)[0m [0;1mSET NAMES 'latin1'[0m [4;35;1mSQL (0.1ms)[0m [0mSET SQL_AUTO_IS_NULL=0[0m Rendering template within layouts/products Rendering products/new

version.body:
I've come across the same problem here I think. Written about it already in this [rails forum](http://railsforum.com/viewtopic.php?id=24578 "Lighthouse") post. And yes I've overridden to_param with:
@@@ def to_param "#{id}-#{permalink}" unless id.nil? end @@@

end
version.title: ActiveResource Failed With Rails 2.2.1

version.body: OK, this defintely looks like a regression, and we'll get it fixed in the next point release.
version.body-html: OK, this defintely looks like a regression, and we'll get it fixed in the next point release.
version.title: ActiveResource Failed With Rails 2.2.1

version.body:
OK, so the issue here is simply this:
@@@ >> Product.new.new_record? => nil @@@
Previously routes were a little more understanding, but no longer.
To fix this for active resource you'll need to submit a patch implementing new_record? for ActiveResource and then everything should be fine.
version.body-html:
OK, so the issue here is simply this:


>> Product.new.new_record?
=> nil

Previously routes were a little more understanding, but no longer.

To fix this for active resource you'll need to submit a patch implementing new_record? for ActiveResource and then everything should be fine.
version.title: ActiveResource Failed With Rails 2.2.1

version.body:
The problem can be solved just by aliasing the existing method new? to new_record?
I did the patch for both edge and 2.2, but the diff is exactly the same, the file doesn't have any change, so it can be applied to master and 2-2-stable.
version.body-html:
The problem can be solved just by aliasing the existing method new? to new_record?

I did the patch for both edge and 2.2, but the diff is exactly the same, the file doesn't have any change, so it can be applied to master and 2-2-stable.

version.body:
Are you having this error with form_for(@project) or is it some other call entirely? Routes is now a little pickier about nil values for mandatory keys, you may be hitting those.
Please attach the routes declaration and form tag that you're using so we can see if there's another issue hiding in there.
version.body-html:
Are you having this error with form_for(@project) or is it some other call entirely? Routes is now a little pickier about nil values for mandatory keys, you may be hitting those.

Please attach the routes declaration and form tag that you're using so we can see if there's another issue hiding in there.
version.title: ActiveResource Failed With Rails 2.2.1

version.body: I'm using resource_controller as well, but I don't think that's the issue, because this works: @@@<% for company in @companies %> <%= link_to 'Show', object_url(company) %> <% end -%>@@@ But this (with a new object in @company) doesn't: @@@<% form_for(:company, :url => object_url(@company)) do |f| %>@@@ And it still breaks when I put in company_url. This is the relevant route: @@@map.resources :companies do |company| company.resources :contacts company.resources :projects end@@@ All of the actions except when passing in a newly-created object work.
version.body-html:
I'm using resource_controller as well, but I don't think that's the issue, because this works:

@@@<% for company in @companies %>

<td><%= link_to 'Show', object_url(company) %></td>
<% end -%>@@@

But this (with a new object in @company) doesn't:

@@@<% form_for(:company, :url => object_url(@company)) do |f| %>@@@

And it still breaks when I put in company_url.

This is the relevant route:

@@@map.resources :companies do |company| company.resources :contacts company.resources :projects end@@@

All of the actions except when passing in a newly-created object work.

`<% form_for(:company, :url => new_object_url) do |f| %>`
So I guess that will work, but it still seems odd the other way doesn't work.
